summaryText: Wow, what an incredible sermon about miracles by Pastor Travis Hearn! Today, PT delivered a powerful message about Jesus' willingness to meet us exactly where we are, highlighting how God is not afraid to break down barriers and build bridges of love. Drawing from the powerful story of Jesus meeting the Samaritan woman at the well, Pastor Travis reminds us that God's miracles aren't just historical events, but present-day realities. He powerfully illustrates that Jesus is willing to reach out to the rejected, the outcast, and those society has deemed unworthy. Can you imagine a God so loving that He would willingly touch a leper when everyone else ran away? That's the miracle of Jesus! Pastor Travis challenges us to understand that true satisfaction comes only through a relationship with Christ - not through worldly pursuits that will always leave us thirsty. The most profound moment? When he reveals that worship isn't about a place, but a person - Jesus Christ himself. This sermon is a beautiful reminder that God is not just a distant deity, but a personal, miracle-working God who is willing to transform our lives completely.
mainPoints: God is willing to meet us where we are
The world cannot truly satisfy like Jesus can
Worship is about a relationship with Jesus, not a physical location

versesMentioned.text: Jesus replied, 'If you only knew the gift that God has for you and who you are speaking to, you would ask me, and I would give you living water.'

After this I looked, and there before me was a great multitude that no one could count, from every nation, tribe, people and language, standing before the throne and before the Lamb. They were wearing white robes and were holding palm branches in their hands. And they cried out in a loud voice: 'Salvation belongs to our God, who sits on the throne, and to the Lamb.'

Who wants all people to be saved and to come to a knowledge of the truth. For there is one God and one mediator between God and mankind, the man Christ Jesus, who gave himself as a ransom for all people.

While Jesus was in one of the towns, a man came along who was covered with leprosy. When he saw Jesus, he fell with his face to the ground and begged him, 'Lord, if you are willing, you can make me clean.' Jesus reached out his hand and touched the man. 'I am willing,' he said. 'Be clean!' And immediately the leprosy left him.
Blessed are those who hunger and thirst for righteousness, for they will be filled.
Therefore, I urge you, brothers and sisters, in view of God's mercy, to offer your bodies as a living sacrifice, holy and pleasing to God—this is your true and proper worship.

Ask and it will be given to you; seek and you will find; knock and the door will be opened to you. For everyone who asks receives; the one who seeks finds; and to the one who knocks, the door will be opened.

Monday.scripture: John 7:37-38: 'If anyone is thirsty, let him come to me and drink. Whoever believes in me, as the Scripture has said, streams of living water will flow from within him.'
Monday.focus: Recognizing spiritual thirst and seeking true satisfaction in Jesus
Monday.action: Spend time reflecting on areas in your life where you've been seeking fulfillment outside of Christ. Write down these areas and pray over them, asking God to replace worldly desires with a genuine thirst for Him.
Monday.prayer: Lord, show me where I've been trying to fill my soul with temporary things. Help me recognize my true spiritual thirst and guide me to Your living water. Amen.

Tuesday.scripture: Psalm 42:1-2: 'As the deer pants for streams of water, so my soul pants for you, my God. My soul thirsts for God, for the living God.'
Tuesday.focus: Developing a deep, genuine hunger for God
Tuesday.action: Create a personal worship playlist of songs that remind you of God's transformative power. Listen to it throughout the day, allowing each song to draw you closer to Him.
Tuesday.prayer: God, create in me a passionate hunger for Your presence. Help me long for You more than anything else in this world. Amen.

Wednesday.scripture: Isaiah 55:1-2: 'Come, all you who are thirsty, come to the waters; and you who have no money, come, buy and eat! Come, buy wine and milk without money and without cost. Why spend money on what is not bread, and your labor on what does not satisfy?'
Wednesday.focus: Understanding the futility of worldly pursuits
Wednesday.action: Make a list of things you've pursued thinking they would bring satisfaction. Reflect on how they compare to the fulfillment found in a relationship with Jesus.
Wednesday.prayer: Father, open my eyes to the temporary nature of worldly pursuits. Help me invest in what truly matters - a deep, meaningful relationship with You. Amen.

Thursday.scripture: Jeremiah 2:13: 'My people have committed two sins: They have forsaken me, the spring of living water, and have dug their own cisterns, broken cisterns that cannot hold water.'
Thursday.focus: Identifying and removing barriers to genuine worship
Thursday.action: Examine your daily routine. Identify and eliminate one distraction that prevents you from fully experiencing God's presence.
Thursday.prayer: Lord, reveal the 'broken cisterns' in my life. Help me tear them down and return to You, the true source of living water. Amen.

Friday.scripture: Revelation 22:17: 'The Spirit and the bride say, 'Come!' And let the one who hears say, 'Come!' Let the one who is thirsty come; and let the one who wishes take the free gift of the water of life.'
Friday.focus: Embracing God's invitation to abundant life
Friday.action: Reach out to someone who seems spiritually thirsty. Share a brief testimony of how Jesus has satisfied your soul.
Friday.prayer: God, use me as a vessel to point others to Your living water. Give me courage and wisdom to share Your love. Amen.

Saturday.scripture: Colossians 2:10: 'And in Christ you have been brought to fullness.'
Saturday.action: Spend time journaling about ways God has filled areas of emptiness in your life. Reflect on His faithfulness and transformative power.
Saturday.prayer: Jesus, thank You for being my ultimate satisfaction. Help me live each day fully embracing the completeness found only in You. Amen.
